sentences.sContent: Having raised expectations (= made people more hopeful ), he went on to help only a few people.
sentences.sCn: 他唤起了大家的希望，但接着只是帮助了几个人。

sentences.sContent: The show exceeded all expectations (= was much better than expected ).
sentences.sCn: 这场演出比人们预期的要好得多。

sentences.sContent: The number of people who attended fell short of expectations (= was lower than expected ).
sentences.sCn: 出席的人数比预期的要少。

sentences.sContent: ...Seventy-four percent of the respondents surveyed report a “good to excellent” expectation of real-estate profitability in 2015...

phrases.pCn: 平均寿命；预期寿命（等于life expectancy）
按照期望做到，不负众望

words.tran: 期待的；怀孕的；预期中的

trans.tranOther: what you think or hope will happen
